meanings.definition: To remove hydrogen and chlorine atoms from a compound.
meanings.sent1: I learned how to dehydrochlorinate the water to make it safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: The scientist will dehydrochlorinate the chemical to study its properties.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dehydrochlorinated the recipe, creating a new dish.
meanings.sent4: She dehydrochlorinated the equation, simplifying it for the students.
meanings.sent5: The cleaning solution dehydrochlorinated the stain, leaving the surface spotless.

meanings.definition: The process of eliminating hydrogen and chlorine atoms from a substance.
meanings.sent1: The dehydrochlorination of the compound was necessary for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use dehydrochlorination to purify certain chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The dehydrochlorination of the pool water made it safe for swimming.
meanings.sent4: The dehydrochlorination of the metal revealed its true composition.
meanings.sent5: The dehydrochlorination process is crucial in creating certain medications.
